textBox.richText: Before our trip to Sonoma and the Napa Valley on Sunday the only Californian Wine I’d ever sampled was out of a cardboard box. Rachel and Darren organised a fantastic day for us. We headed out early morning to Sonoma where we had a true American breakfast at an establishment called the Black Bear Diner. It was a true education in good old American heart starting food. At the risk of copping flack for talking about food again I won’t go into details. Lets just say after breakfast none of us needed to eat for at least a month!  Sonoma is such a pretty town. Just out of the city centre we drove down winery alley past B.R Cohn which is owned by the Doobie Brothers and dropped into Chateau St Jean whose landscaping and architecture seemed to be modelled around European wineries of earlier vintage. It was truly amazing. There are a couple of pics in the photo gallery. After the wine tour we all headed to Spring Lake Park to sample some of Sonoma’s finest (the wine was a Benziger) along with a picnic that Rachel and Darren had prepared. It was such a fantastic day and it caped off a great weekend that we had with Felicity’s cousins. Rachel and Darren were great fun and it was sad to say goodbye. No doubt we’ll see them soon in Bora Bora!!
